cab.content: Military Secret. 1320From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India, - . Sth March 1920.(Received 9th.)' 3108. 8tli March. Malleson wires report from Bokhara, dated 11th February: "It is believed in popular circles that Amir of Bokhara has agreed to following :-" (1) The circulation of the Bolshevik paper money." (2) The export of grain." (3) Bolshevik subjects may enter Bokhara." (4) That Amir assists in repair of Kerki railway." Amir has refused to allow young Bokharans expelled by him to return or to Teduce his army before Bolsheviks retired from Kagan."
